data.title: TWIT TV Roku Channel : No Content
data.meta_description: As of Jan 7th 2024, I see that the TWIT TV channel on Roku has no content. The channel opens to a TWIT background screen, but nothing more. No episodes . No subcategories. Just a background image. Has TWIT left Roku ? I see content on YouTube and
data.text:
As of Jan 7th 2024, I see that the TWIT TV channel on Roku has no content. The channel opens to a TWIT background screen, but nothing more. No episodes . No subcategories. Just a background image. Has TWIT left Roku ? I see content on YouTube and the channel is still in the Roku library of channels. What is going on? Has Leo left the building?

Yes. Dead for me two. I note that the App is now at Version 2 build 0.

I have sent feedback via the channel review. That said, if they don't plan to populate the content, then they really should remove the App from the store.

yeah, I will miss them if they go. long time listener, over a decade.

that is the problem with a single central driving figure... he needs a succession plan, but I don't really see any candidates.

Hi @rwhewitt @deag,

Thanks for reaching out here in the Roku Community!

We appreciate your inquiry regarding the TWIT channel. Please note that a channel may no longer be accessible on the Roku platform if you are unable to discover it in the Streaming Store. The channel publisher is in charge of developing and managing the channel.

For more information, we advise you to get in touch with the channel publisher directly to ask for assistance and request that they update their channel on the Roku platform.

You may also refer to this link and read about Why is an app no longer available on my Roku streaming device? | Official Roku Support.â€œ

Please let us know if there's anything else we can help you with.

All the best,

Chel

Jecheal R.

Roku Community Moderator

Hello! @deag,

Thanks for the post,

We would be more than happy to investigate further, but we will need further details. Can you please provide us with the following information?

Roku device model, serial number, device ID, and software OS/version (these can all be found in Settings > System > About)

Does this issue occur on a specific channel? if so, what channel and what version or build is the channel (this can be found by selecting the channel on the Home screen and pressing the * button)?

tracker ID when this issue occurs (when you see this issue occur, press the Home button five times, followed by the Back button five times, and provide us with this ID)

If possible, video and/or pictures of the issue

Once we have this information, we will be able to pass it along to the appropriate Roku team to investigate further.

We look forward to working with you to help resolve this issue.

Thanks,

Arjiemar

Arjiemar

Roku Community Moderator
